definitions: To arise or occur, especially unexpectedly.
To approach or move towards someone or something.
To be built or grow out of the ground.
To reach a higher level or position.
To be presented for consideration or decision.
examples: The topic came up in our meeting.
He came up to me and asked a question.
New houses are coming up in the area.
She's coming up in the company.
The issue will come up for a vote.
